Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Squash \Squash\, v. t. [imp. & p. p. {Squashed} (skw[o^]sht); p. pr. & vb. n. {Squashing}.] [OE. squachen, OF. escachier, esquachier, to squash, to crush, F. ['e]cacher, perhaps from (assumed) LL. excoacticare, fr. L. ex + coactare to constrain, from cogere, coactum, to compel. Cf. {Cogent}, {Squat}, v. i.] To beat or press into pulp or a flat mass; to crush. [1913 Webster]
squashed adj : that has been violently compressed; "the squashed looking nakedness of the fledgling birds"
